results.title: A Point of return
results.creator_credit: Carl Stevenson and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Presents the problem of suicide as discussed by doctors, psychiatrists, and social workers. Uses a case history to point out that the causes and related aspects of suicide are not always understood. Includes an introduction by Dr Karl Menninger.
results.description: Presents the problem of suicide as discussed by doctors, psychiatrists, and social workers. Uses a case history to point out that the causes and related aspects of suicide are not always understood. Includes an introduction by Dr Karl Menninger.

results.title: A room for Romeo Brass
results.creator_credit: Shane Meadows, Charles Pattinson, George Faber, BBC Film Unit and Alliance Atlantis
results.brief_description: Shane Meadows writes and directs this drama about two young boys’ friendship and their coming-of-age. Neighbours, the boys share life experiences (and porno magazines) and support each other as one is physically unwell and the other’s parents have separated. The friendship is tested however when a creepy stranger manipulates his way into their lives by trying to date the attractive older sister of Romeo. Tensions arise as the stranger becomes more violent as his affections are rejected. Touching, funny and disturbing, this feature stars Paddy Considine as the stranger, with wonderful performances by the two young leads Andrew Shim and Ben Marshall. Bob Hoskins makes an appearance as a visiting teacher. Soundtrack features music by Beck, Beth Orton and Billy Bragg.

results.title: A River somewhere. - Vol. 1 & 2.
results.creator_credit: Rob Sitch, Tom Gleisner, Debra Choate, ABC-TV (Australia) and Frontline Television Productions
results.brief_description: Filmed on location in Australia, New Zealand, Venezuela, Scotland and Italy, Tom Gleisner and Rob Sitch allow their passion for fly fishing to take them around the world, visiting some of the most remote and beautiful waterways. Using a variety of transportation methods including vespa and post van, the two fishermen are determined to catch their dinner and cook it in the local style. “A River somewhere” is a viewing treat and with the wry wit and humour of Sitch and Gleisner, the program is both entertaining and visually breathtaking.

results.title: A River runs through it
results.creator_credit: Robert Redford, Patrick Markey and Allied Filmmakers
results.brief_description: Norman Maclean’s novel has been brought to life under the skillful direction of Robert Redford and fine performances by Tom Skerrit, Brad Pitt and Craig Sheffer. Set in the mountain wilderness of Montana between 1910-1935, the story focuses on the relationship between two brothers. Their upbringing at the hands of their strict missionary father influences the boys to chose different paths. One brother goes down the road to success while the other’s path is filled with trouble and heartbreak. The two brothers share little in common except their passion for fly fishing which unites them.

results.title: A Red ribbon
results.creator_credit: Marc De Rossi, Pedro Jose Frank Nemeth, Patricia De Rossi and Ard Norddeutscher Rundfunk
results.brief_description: A non-narrated story with simply a musical score background about a young boy’s unsuccessful attempts to fly a kite. Discouraged he gives up and goes home. However, his female companion comes to his rescue with the aid of her red hair ribbon which she attaches to the tail of the kite. A sensitive film that raises issues about the value of friendship and co-operation. Music by Vincente Salvia. Cast: Ledice Fernandes de Oliviera, Marcos da Silva. Suitable for primary school level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marc De Rossi, Pedro Jose Frank Nemeth, Patricia De Rossi and Ard Norddeutscher Rundfunk

results.title: A Real man's job: Images of Australian women in wartime [kit]
results.creator_credit: Felicity Cockram, ImMEDIAte Action, Australian War Memorial and History Teacher's Association of Victoria
results.brief_description: Subtitled Images of Australian women in wartime this kit aims to identify the real contribution that women made during both world wars and also at the images of women in wartime that were projected. Authored by Tim Gurry, Robert Lewis and Richard Reid, the kit draws together a wide variety of material with suggestions for its use, into nine Evidence Files, a videocassette and Teacher’s notes.

results.title: A Rat's tale = Die Story von Monty Spinnerratz
results.creator_credit: Michael F. Huse, Hans Peter Clahsen, Warner Bros Pictures and Monty Filmgesellschaft
results.brief_description: Featuring marionettes from Germany’s Augsburger Puppet Theatre, this is a love story with a difference, where the action is below the city streets and the star crossed lovers are rodents. The story is a combination of the children’s book by Tor Seidler and illustrated by Fred Marcellino, and an elaboration on a short story pilot by Monty Spinnerratz. Isabella Noble-Rat is swept off her feet by Monty Mad-Rat Jnr. after an impressive tour of New York’s underground sewers. Her parents are against their daughter’s union with someone beneath their station, much to Isabella’s chagrin. There are bigger issues at hand however as the rat community is threatened by rising drain waters and a proposed mass extermination of the rodent community. Perhaps Isabella’s beau can save the day and impress her snooty parents at the same time. Cast includes Beverly D’Angelo, Jerry Stiller, Josef Ostendorf and Lauren Hutton, and featuring the voices of Lynsey Bartilson, Ray Guth, Scott MacDonald and Donald Arthur.

results.title: A Question of time
results.creator_credit: Don Levy, Stephen Toulmin, Judy Goodfield and Nuffield Foundation
results.brief_description: Treats in a new cinematic manner man’s unequal struggle to gain an intellectual grasp on the idea of time, its origin, measurement and place in theoretical physics. An exploration of the concept of time reduced to a human scale and ranging through the major historical developments; mans first notion of time; its relation to movement and more recent concepts of biological time, time in relativistic terms.

results.title: A Question of balance
results.creator_credit: Steve Christiansen, Mat Scully and ACT Schools Authority
results.brief_description: Examines the role of the arts in the education system. Emphasis is placed upon the role in which the arts helps develop self awareness, self esteem and creative ability in children.

results.title: A Puppet pudding
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation, David Perry, Michael Creighton and Marionette Theatre of Australia
results.brief_description: An introduction to the world of Norman Lindsay’s classic Australian children’s story “The Magic Pudding”, using puppets from the Marionette Theatre of Australia’s stage production. Explores the background to the writing of the story and looks behind the scenes of Australia’s national puppet theatre. Concludes with characters on stage at the Sydney Opera House. Presenter: Richard Bradshaw.
